alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 4:32AM CST until March 03 at 1:47AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tennessee River AT Florence affecting Colbert and Lauderdale Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River AT Florence. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, Water covers the parking lot of the Marina at McFarland Park...with extensive flooding occurring at the soccer fields and golf course within the park. Water is also beginning to cover the road that goes underneath U.S. Highways 43 and 72 at the new playground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM CST Friday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 20.9 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall to 20.3 feet and begin rising again Monday evening. It will rise to 20.4 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 03/08/1902. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
